original: Fristedt, Knut Albrekt (Alle), fd. konsul, Norrköping, f. 12/4/72 i Linköp. av kronolänsm. August F. o. Anna Gröna. G. 07 m. Karin Ekstam. Barn: Greta f. 08, Bror Erik 11, Elsa 13. — Mog:ex. i Linköp. 91. Res. t. flkrt. europ. länder. Anst. i firma Axel Andersén & Co. 91, dir. o. deläg. i A-B Axel Andersén & Co.-Eftr. sed. 00, verk’st. dir. sed. 10. Tjeckoslov. konsul 22-40. Led. av östergötl. o. Södermani. hand:kamm. o. av tjeckoslov, hand:kamm. i Sthlm, led. av styr. f. J. Fristedts A-B, led. av Norrköp. köp-m:fören. o. hand :fören., v. ordf. i centr:styr. f. östgötabanken samt ordf. i Riksfören. f. svenskh. bev. i uti. 25 år, led. av styr. f. Gustavianska stift, i Norrköp., led. av RK 30 år, led. av Hedvigs förs. kyrkoråd, kyrkvärd, fd. !led. av kyrkofulllm. o. stads-fullm. m. m. Hobbies: lantbruk, filateli. RVO, RTjslVLO.
translated: Fristedt, Knut Albrekt (Alle), former consul, Norrköping, born April 12th, 1872 in Linköping, as the son of August F. and Anna Gröna, a county magistrate. Married in 1907 to Karin Ekstam. They have three children: Greta born in 1908, Bror Erik born in 1911, and Elsa born in 1913. Graduated from Mogilev in Linköping in 1891. Traveled throughout several countries in Europe. Employed at Axel Andersén & Co from 1891, became a director and partner in the company A-B Axel Andersén & Co.-Eftr since 1900, and worked as an executive managing director near 1910. Appointed the Czechoslovakian consul from 1922 to 1940. A member of the Chamber of Commerce for East and South Sweden and the Swedish Chamber of Commerce in Stockholm. He was the director of the J. Fristedts A-B board, and a member and vice president of the central committee for östgötabanken, as well as the chairman of the National Association for Swedish Residents Abroad for 25 years. He was a member of the Gustavianska Foundation board in Norrköping, Royal Chamberlain for 30 years, and a member of the church council for Hedvigs förs. He has been a former member of various councils such as the church assembly and city council. Hobbies include farming and philately. Fristedt was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa and the Order of the White Lion.
